documents.document: It takes one to know one. https://t.co/sb7qUhkafG
I love that there's still a light sabre stashed under Miss9's bed within easy reach. #JustIncase
@BR3NDA don't worry, most names in NZ aren't officially assigned...
@cafuego @martinkrafft @kattekrab my brother in law mentioned Four Pillars today, so I showed him this picture. He was very impressed.
@martinkrafft yeah, I received that as well.
The topic is bad enough, but the coding style is even worse, no indentation, inconsistent brace location... https://t.co/cE1lkKlz28
@vodafoneNZ Hey, the screenshot that @ibeardslee posted contains the same as what I'm seeing.
@vodafoneNZ uh, no, that error is coming from your web server.
@vodafoneNZ tried a different browser, still "Client address is not authorised.", it's the link titled "at work tolls pricing table".
Hey @vodafonenz the link to International Calling Rates on https://t.co/JZ4P3rVWmd is busted. " Access Denied"
@LCANetworks thanks for the tubes!
@GraemeEdgeler your prediction was correct. All I had to do was throw out a tube of toothpaste.
It was a lovely smooth landing.
Goodbye Australia and goodbye @linuxconfau for another year #lca2017
@wizzyrea my fingers are crossed!
@ranginui stay in Sydney? ;)
Hey Wellington weather, you'd better calm down in the next few hours, I'm flying home tonight!
@andychilton @callahad @fmarier wow, this industry is just the right at size!
Heh, @callahad I realised on the flight you'll likely know my friend at @mozilla since he worked on Persona: @fmarier
Bye Hobart, it's been fun and I'll miss you! #lca2017
@JohnMilkspill I will now though. NAT64, RFC7915 & RFC6144
Gah, I can hear the TV from the hotel room next door.
@JohnMilkspill there's some RFCs for this. But I'm not going to dig them up right now...
@callahad fantastic, thanks Dan. See you in the morning.
Hotel computer work printer not support USB thumb drives? Upload PDF to Seafile, share the link. Access from computer, print document.
@ThisCJ I'm flying back in tomorrow. I'll keep an eye on things.
@widged hopefully people can use what ever water tank they want.
@kyhwana it'll push the cost of new houses up, but a great idea. The interlock to cut output when the mains goes will need to be bypassed.
Wow, Wellington City Council are talking about making solar panels and water tanks mandatory for all new houses. Civil defense purposes.
Looking at the yachts out in the harbour at Hobart. Wish I was out there, looks wonderful!
@GraemeEdgeler I'll report back. :)
Hey @SusanneRuthven look what I found in Hobart: community organic garden! https://t.co/9Yw0KbZNT7
@VikOlliver I have stood in the baggage claim hall and eaten most of a bunch of bananas before entering Australia before...
I wonder what airport security will say when I carry this kit is sensors onto the plane. #lca2017 https://t.co/NYzeKIW7ph
Very happy that the @OpenComputePrj launched the ANZ Chapter at my #lca2017 presentation. Thank you!
@mithro hey, I should collect that im-tomu from you. When works for you?
@BR3NDA @jonoxer @zindello @cefiar @projectgus I was thinking a light sensor might be handy if that could tell if in direct sunlight.
@callahad @slyall I'll be at Wrest Point Saturday night was well. Sounds like a plan to me!
@stewartsmith but the glare on my screen is to much. Should have brought a OLPC XO...
@sodoscarfono hah, just make sure I don't run the dishwasher at the same time. We'll get a dedicated 16A circuit installed.
Any friends with Virgin lounge access hanging out at Melbourne airport? #lca2017 #cheeky
@puck_ hello Melbourne, nice to see you again. Sorry but I won't be staying long. #lca2017
On our way to Australia for #lca2017. Woohoo!
@noisymime I'm traveling light, so only conference shirt is mine. :) #lca2017
Just discovered that charging the EV, while running the dishwasher can trip to the circuit breaker. Which also turned off the freezer. #oops
Just been to @WellingtonZoo and now have three sleeping kids in the car and Miss9 is yawning away.
Damn. Need to schedule a maintenance window with the kids to replace a failing HDD in a home server. #DadOps
That time of the year again! https://t.co/2jXuCnDGcQ
@stevebiddle @buzzyNZ Ah, interesting. I don't think I've done online check-in for international flights from NZ.
@buzzyNZ @stevebiddle my aim is to always travel with no checked bags. Makes life easier in so many ways!
@stevebiddle @buzzyNZ Sadly I don't have @airnz Koru, so don't have to worry about verifying details. But you can show the phone based pass.
@stevebiddle I'm a sucker for punishment? They claim check in closes 90min before departure time, but yes, I might push it out.
Booked a taxi to go to the airport on Sunday to fly to @linuxconfau . 03:10 pickup. That's O for OMFG That's Early.
Damn. Just checked when my @linuxconfau talk is scheduled and there's 2 other conflicting sessions I would have attended.
Miss9 just realised that the new deck will go past her window. Immediate request: Can I have doors onto it???
@BR3NDA yup, sounds good
@VikOlliver yeah, I have enough power tools to injure my self with, and most of my trees are tiny. Busy wishing for a belt sander though...
@VikOlliver true, but sadly I don't own one. I've cleared enough vegetation that we should have another year before I need to do it again.
@BR3NDA sigh. :(
@BR3NDA ah ha! Yes, I'd started installing OpenHAB and was starting to loose hope. I'll check out home assistant. Cheers!
@VikOlliver nah, send in the lopers with extendable arms
@BR3NDA looks interesting, but what does it add to OpenHAB? I'm still an OpenHAB newbie
@freitasm @slyall that's what I was wondering. How'd they make the payments and do other useful things like buy food?!
Actually that message just makes me close the tab and read something else. https://t.co/mKgL1m6eZu
@puck_ yup, that and some other trees not visible were the issue. Have signal again. #phew
@JohnMilkspill the puritan would say everything in Ansible. The realist though...
I think I found why my satellite TV feed stopped working. https://t.co/nyoyZaxBHB
@ibeardslee @rbtcollins @BR3NDA @SusanneRuthven there's an e-bike shop in Petone, not sure what they're like.
@GrowFromHereNZ a mix of Kauri, Manuka and Kowhai and various ground cover natives.
@ChrisKeall ah, now would you buy one? Shame they're only 5 seater. We need at least 6 so stuck with our petrol Outlander.
@rbtcollins I've been eyeing up some wood burner ones, but I agree it'll need to be pretty big to fit 60 trees. Ideally big enough for 2.
@BR3NDA @SusanneRuthven has been looking into electric bikes. We're considering getting a conversion kit.
@purserj sadly very few people understand this.
Today I planted about 30 trees up one side of our driveway. Tomorrow I get to do the other side. Really need a hot tub.
@ranginui my mother did that when she dropped a frozen chicken on her toes. #ouch
@jdub because people were going to be grumpy that it was always broken in unexpected ways?
@martinkrafft @BiellaColeman they're special builds from @lenovo. I have one. :)
@JohnMilkspill nope, the one that crapped out the other week while I was driving home.
W00t, sold the old car.
@andychilton certainly talks about fertiliser etc, but not too bad. Disclaimer: I've only flicked through it.
@andychilton Yates Garden Guide. It has a chapter titled "The Perfect Lawn".
@bopolissimus sadly my lawn was nonexistent when we moved in. The grounds looked like there had been a tank battle. #JoysOfBuilding
Sigh. Reading how to prepare a lawn and finding out all the things we did wrong with our lawn. (Everything)
@saniac I miss the days of stamping the due date in the back of library books. Told you lots about popularity of a book
@JohnMilkspill and they wonder why random websites are broken for them?
@BR3NDA is quality of internet connection a new criteria for selecting holiday destinations?
@VikOlliver @gosamv those things would certainly help. Cheaper EV cars would really help. We're happy with our newish Nissan Leaf though.
@BR3NDA sounds like you need a home weather station...
@dritchie haven't seen what this is in reference to, but you realise you can get adapters to use standard bottles?
@BR3NDA @nzpostYouShop @adafruit same with @thinkgeek
@johndalton some nominated folks may have declined to stand.
@sarahsharp and indexed and cross referenced with relevant and irrelevant law enforcement agencies...
Sigh, just spent several hours wonder what was going on with @SusanneRuthven's laptop after a Windows update only to find known issue.
While I'm wearing a @CatalystNZ shirt, purely personal. Would make great company cars though. https://t.co/AVHv2x0EtS
@ThisCJ @Yahoo right everyone, get a new first pet and change your mother's maiden name.
@majicDave @juhasaarinen I was already an accidental subscriber. But having tried any of the videos yet.
@cafuego there's a medical waste disposal place nearby, they'll incinerate hard drives...
@majicDave @juhasaarinen they just launched here. Yesterday?
@GraemeEdgeler @eey0re @BarristerNZ and can convince legal aid that their case is worthy...
@juhasaarinen I'm picturing Vladimir Putin with his shirt off at a keyboard as he personally breaks into the computer systems. #MakeItStop
